answers.text: a period encompassing the activities related to the Space Race, space exploration, space technology, and the cultural developments influenced by these events.

qas.question: How long does did it take for the Sputnik 1 to orbit the earth?
How many people watched the Apollo 11 landing?

context: The Space Age is <a0_0>a period encompassing the activities related to the Space Race, space exploration, space technology, and the cultural developments influenced by these events.<a0_0/> The Space Age began with the development of several technologies that culminated with the launch of Sputnik 1 by <a1_0>the Soviet Union.<a1_0/> This was the world's first artificial satellite, orbiting the Earth in <a2_0>98.1 minutes<a2_0/> and weighing in at 83 kg. The launch of Sputnik 1 ushered a new era of political, scientific and technological achievements that became known as the Space Age. The Space Age was characterized by rapid development of new technology in a close race mostly between the United States and the Soviet Union. <a3_0>The Space Age<a3_0/> brought the first human spaceflight during the Vostok programme and reached its peak with the Apollo program which captured the imagination of much of the world's population. The landing of Apollo 11 was an event watched by over <a4_0>500 million<a4_0/> people around the world and is widely recognized as one of the defining moments of the 20th century. Since then and with the end of the space race due to the dissolution of the Soviet Union, public attention has largely moved to other areas.
